alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Rogers; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 19 at 4:29AM CDT until July 19 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 108 expected and afternoon temperatures of 105 degrees or greater. * WHERE...Cherokee, Adair, Rogers, Mayes, Delaware, Ottawa, Washington OK, Osage, Craig and Nowata Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Very hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 911.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Rogers; Washington
